articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians have waited for two days at roadblocks.
articles.title: Hamas to release Israeli hostage Yehud, two others before Friday, Israel to allow Gazans to return home north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwandan-backed rebels marched into the centre of east Congo's largest city, witnesses said, in the latest escalation of decades of conflict in a region already suffering one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.
articles.title: Congo rebels reach centre of eastern city in major escalation

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A Hamas official reacted with suspicion to the remarks, echoing longstanding Palestinian fears about being driven permanently from their homes.
articles.title: Trump says Jordan, Egypt should take more Palestinians from Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko extended his 31-year rule with a massive win in a presidential election that Western governments have rejected as a sham, according to preliminary results on Monday.
articles.title: Lukashenko pockets massive win in Belarus election scorned by the West

articles.author: Barbara Erling, Kuba Stezycki
articles.description: Auschwitz survivors will be joined by world leaders on Monday to mark the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi German death camp by Soviet troops, in what will likely be one of the last such gatherings of those who experienced its horrors.
articles.title: Auschwitz survivors to mark 80th anniversary of camp's liberation

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: A new school textbook that likens Russia's war in Ukraine to the Soviet struggle against the Nazis and says Russia was "forced" to send troops into Ukraine was presented in Moscow on Monday.
articles.title: Russia issues school textbook saying it was 'forced' to march into Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain on Monday imposed sanctions targeting Belarusian officials and defence companies after joining Western governments in condemning what they called "sham" presidential elections in the country.
articles.title: UK sanctions Belarusian officials and condemns 'sham' election

articles.author: Sonia Rolley, David Lewis
articles.description: Corneille Nangaa is the public face of a sprawling coalition of Congolese politicians and rebel groups fighting to oust President Felix Tshisekedi.
articles.title: Congo's ex-election chief turned rebel boss builds insurgency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Residents greeted the arrival of Rwanda-backed rebels with trepidation, some staying indoors and others coming out to cheer in what one called a "show" of happiness.
articles.title: With fear and fist-bumps, Goma residents greet Congo's M23 rebels again

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Oliver Griffin
articles.description: The US and Colombia pulled back from the brink of a trade war after the White House said the South American nation had agreed to accept military aircraft carrying deported migrants.
articles.title: US, Colombia reach deal on deportations; tariff, sanctions put on hold
